revised_title: Development and Formation of Subaxial Arches in the Human Skeleton
tldr: The author examines the formation of subaxial arches in the human skeleton, specifically focusing on the frontonasal, maxillary, mandibular, lingual, hyoid, laryngeal, and exoccipital arches. The study describes the development of these arches during the fifth to twelfth weeks of fetal life, detailing the changes in cartilage and membrane structures that contribute to the growth of the human skull and neck.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Anatomy and Development
